fr.zelus.jarvis.plugins.discord.module.io

Class DiscordInputProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zelus.jarvis.io.EventProvider
      • fr.zelus.jarvis.io.IntentProvider
        • fr.zelus.jarvis.plugins.discord.module.io.DiscordInputProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class DiscordInputProvider
extends IntentProvider
    A Discord user IntentProvider.

    This class relies on the JDA library to receive direct messages and react to them. Note that this input provider only captures direct messages (sent in private channels) sent to the Discord bot associated to this class.

    Instances of this class must be configured with a Configuration instance holding the Discord bot API token in the property JarvisDiscordUtils.DISCORD_TOKEN_KEY. This token is used to authenticate the bot and receive messages through the JDA client.

    See Also:
    JarvisDiscordUtils, IntentProvider

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiscordInputProvider

        public DiscordInputProvider(JarvisCore jarvisCore,
                            Configuration configuration)
        Constructs a new DiscordInputProvider from the provided JarvisCore and Configuration.

        This constructor initializes the underlying JDA client and creates a message listener that forwards to the jarvisCore instance not empty direct messages sent by users (not bots) to the bot private channel (see PrivateMessageListener.

        Note: DiscordInputProvider requires a valid Discord bot API token to be initialized, and calling the default constructor will throw an IllegalArgumentException when looking for the Discord bot token.

        Parameters:
        jarvisCore - the JarvisCore instance used to handle messages
        configuration - the Configuration used to retrieve the Discord bot token
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided Configuration is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided Discord bot token is null or empty
        See Also:
        JarvisDiscordUtils, PrivateMessageListener

    • Method Detail

      • getJdaClient

        protected net.dv8tion.jda.core.JDA getJdaClient()
        Returns the JDA client associated to this class.

        Note: this method is protected for testing purposes, and should not be called by client code.

        Returns:
        the JDA client associated to this class
